title: Spatial Ability Training for STEM Education: Restricted vs. Unrestricted Rotation Training

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental knowledge of geometry and basic understanding of three-dimensional shapes
context.additional_context: Training program for pre-service/in-service teachers to enhance spatial abilities required in STEM education, featuring lightweight mobile-optimized content and formative assessment-based learning effect monitoring

learning_goals: Learners can improve spatial cognition ability by at least 20% through restricted rotation training of 3D shapes.
Learners achieve problem-solving speeds at least 15% faster with restricted rotation training compared to unrestricted rotation training.
Learners can accurately predict and explain shape deformations under various rotation conditions (restricted/unrestricted).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
